intro: Craspedia plebeia, commonly known as the common craspedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Craspedia plebeia is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to tolerate salt spray.
